BRDFLight

new BRDFLight()
Properties
color (Texture) : The self-illumination color
colorMultiplier (TextureFloat) : Color Multiplier
transparency (Texture) : Transparency of the BRDF
doubleSided (boolean) : If false, the light color is black for back-facing surfaces
emitOnBackSide (boolean) : Emit on back side
channels (List<Object>) : Render channels the result of this BRDF will be written to
compensateExposure (boolean) : Compensate camera exposure
multiplyByOpacity (boolean) : When enabled the color of the light brdf is multiplied by the brdf's opacity ( inverse of the brdf's transparency )
affect_gi (boolean) : When enabled, the light emission affects GI rays and illuminates the scene

TexColorCurve

new TexColorCurve()
Properties
input (Texture) : The value from this texture is controlled by the profile curve.
inputScalar (TextureFloat) : If present input is ignored, and this is used instead.
rkeys (List<Float>) : Quadruplets of 2d vectors for each bezier segment for the red curve.
gkeys (List<Float>) : Quadruplets of 2d vectors for each bezier segment for the green curve.
bkeys (List<Float>) : Quadruplets of 2d vectors for each bezier segment for the blue curve.
use_alpha (boolean) : Get alpha from curve
akeys (List<Float>) : Quadruplets of 2d vectors for each bezier segment for the alpha curve.

TexColorExponential

new TexColorExponential()
Properties
input (Texture) : The value used in the operation.
factor (Texture) : The factor to be used in the operation.
operation (int) : The operation: 0=Exponential, 1=Logarithm, 2=Bias, 3=Gain
use_alpha (boolean) : Apply operation to alpha channel

VRayImage

Represents a V-Ray image.

new VRayImage(width: integer, height: integer)
Parameters
width (integer)
height (integer)
Instance Members
▸ compressSync(format, [quality], [preserveAlpha], [renderer])

Compresses the V-Ray image to the specified format synchronously. This is a blocking call.

compressSync(format: string, quality: [integer], preserveAlpha: [boolean], renderer: [VRayRenderer]): buffer
Parameters
format (string) Can be 'bmp', 'png' or 'jpg' ('jpeg'). Not required if the type can be determined from the filename extension.
quality ([integer] (default 0) ) The value of the parameter is an integer value between 0 and 100. Used for the jpeg format.
preserveAlpha ([boolean]) Used only for png and bmp formats.
renderer ([VRayRenderer]) If there are warnings and/or errors during the compression process, they will be emitted via dumpMessage event in the supplied renderer.
Returns
buffer: A buffer containing the compressed image bytes.
Example
var imageBytes = image.compressSync('png');
▸ draw(img, [x], [y])

Draws the passed image over this one.

draw(img: VRayImage, x: [integer], y: [integer]): boolean
Parameters
img (VRayImage)
x ([integer]) The horizontal position from which the image is to be drawn. If missing, the 'x' property from the passed image will be used if available. (BucketImage has 'x' property.)
y ([integer]) The vertical position from which the image is to be drawn. If missing, the 'y' property from the passed image will be used if available. (BucketImage has 'y' property.)
Returns
boolean: true on success.
Example
image.draw(img, 30, 40);
▸ addColor(color)

Adds the color to all pixels of this image.

addColor(color: Color): boolean
Parameters
color (Color)
Returns
boolean: true on success.
Example
color = vray.Color(0.1, 0.1, 0.1);
image.addColor(color);	// make this image lighter with no black values
▸ changeExposure(ev)

Changes the exposure of this image. Makes the image darker or brighter.

changeExposure(ev: float): boolean
Parameters
ev (float) A relative exposure value or EV
Returns
boolean: true on success.
Example
image.changeExposure(0.1);	// make this image brighter
▸ changeContrast(value)

Changes the contrast of this image

changeContrast(value: float): boolean
Parameters
value (float) A relative contrast value from -1 to +1. Values too close to 1 may give wrong result.
Returns
boolean: true on success.
Example
image.changeContrast(0.2);	// increase the contrast of this image
▸ changeGamma(gamma)

Changes the gamma of this image.

changeGamma(gamma: float): boolean
Parameters
gamma (float) Gamma value from 0 to +inf.
Returns
boolean: true on success.
Example
image.changeGamma(1.2);	// make this image lighter
▸ makeNegative()

Make this image negative. Currently this is just an eye pleasing approximation so don't expect that calling this function twice will revert the image to its original state.

makeNegative(): boolean
Returns
boolean: true on success.
Example
image.makeNegative();
▸ toBitmapData([options], stride)

Read 8-bit bitmap data from this image (without BMP headers). Default channel order is BGR, no alpha, top-bottom.

toBitmapData(options: [JSON/object], stride: any): Buffer
Parameters
options ([JSON/object])
Name Description
options.preserveAlpha boolean Include the alpha channel in the resultant bitmap. false - BGR/RGB (bytes_per_pixel = 3), true - BGRA/RGBA (bytes_per_pixel = 4).
options.swapChannels boolean Swap red and blue channel. false/default - BGR(A), true - RGB(A).
options.reverseY boolean Reverse Y-axis. false/default - fill top-bottom bitmap, true - fill bottom-top bitmap.
stride (any) The byte offset between the beginning of two consecutive rows of the output bitmap. if (stride > 0) use max(stride, width bytes_per_pixel). if (stride== 0) use width bytes_per_pixel rounded up to the smallest factor of 4 (this the default for BMP). if (stride < 0) use width*bytes_per_pixel rounded up to the smallest factor of -stride; -stride must be a power of 2.
Returns
Buffer: The requested bitmap data.
Example
var bitmapData = image.toBitmapData({ reverseY: true });
▸ save(fileName, [format], [quality], [preserveAlpha], [renderer], [callback])

Saves the V-Ray image to the specified file comressed in the specified format.

save(fileName: string, format: [string], quality: [integer], preserveAlpha: [boolean], renderer: [VRayRenderer], callback: [function (err)])
Parameters
fileName (string) The name of the file.
format ([string]) Can be 'bmp', 'png' or 'jpg' ('jpeg'). Not required if the type can be determined from the filename extension.
quality ([integer] (default 0) ) The value of the parameter is an integer value between 0 and 100. Used for the jpeg format.
preserveAlpha ([boolean]) Used only for png and bmp formats.
renderer ([VRayRenderer]) If there are warnings and/or errors during the compression process, they will be emitted via dumpMessage event in the supplied renderer.
callback ([function (err)]) A callback function to be called after the file is saved. The only optional argument is an error exception object.
Example
image.save('car.jpg', function(err) {
if (err) {
	throw err;
}
console.log('Image is saved.');
});
▸ compress(format, [quality], [preserveAlpha], [renderer], [callback])

Compresses the V-Ray image to the specified format.

compress(format: string, quality: [integer], preserveAlpha: [boolean], renderer: [VRayRenderer], callback: [function (err, buf)])
Parameters
format (string) Can be 'bmp', 'png' or 'jpg' ('jpeg'). Not required if the type can be determined from the filename extension.
quality ([integer] (default 0) ) The value of the parameter is an integer value between 0 and 100. Used for the jpeg format.
preserveAlpha ([boolean]) Used only for png and bmp formats.
renderer ([VRayRenderer]) If there are warnings and/or errors during the compression process, they will be emitted via dumpMessage event in the supplied renderer.
callback ([function (err, buf)]) A callback function to be called after the file compression has finished. The first argument is an exception error object. The second argument is a buffer which accepts the compressed image bytes.
Example
image.compress('png', function(err, buf) {
if (err) throw err;
});
▸ close()

Closes the image and releases image bytes. After an image has been closed you can no longer use its methods. It is not obligatory to close the image and you can leave it to the garbage collector but it is a good practice if you use many images and do not need the old ones.

close()
Example
image.close();
▸ downscale(width, height, callback)

Creates a new V-Ray image which is a downscaled version of the current. The new image dimensions cannot be greater than the source image dimensions.

downscale(width: integer, height: integer, callback: function (image))
Parameters
width (integer)
height (integer)
callback (function (image)) A callback function to be called after the scaling is done. The only argument of the callback is the new downscaled image.
Example
image.downscale(180, 180, function(newImage) {
newImage.save('downscaled.jpg', function(err) {});
});
▸ fitIn(width, height, callback)

Either downscales or just clones the image to fit it into a rectangle with the given dimensions. This method preserves the image aspect ratio.

fitIn(width: integer, height: integer, callback: function (image))
Parameters
width (integer) The width of the rectangle.
height (integer) The height of the rectangle.
callback (function (image)) A callback function that is called after the scaling is done. The only argumet of the callback is the new image.
Example
image.fitIn(180, 180, function(newImage) {
newImage.save('fit.jpg', function(err) {});
});
▸ cutIn(width, height, callback)

Either downscales or just clones the image in order for a rectangle to fit into the image. The new image is the part of the image that fits in the rectange. The other parts are cut. This method preserves the image aspect ratio.

cutIn(width: integer, height: integer, callback: function (image))
Parameters
width (integer)
height (integer)
callback (function (image)) A callback function that is called after the scaling is done. The only argumet of the callback is the new image.
Example
image.cutIn(180, 180, function(newImage) {
newImage.save('cut.jpg', function(err) {});
});
▸ crop(x, y, width, height)

Returns a new image which is cropped from this one.

crop(x: integer, y: integer, width: integer, height: integer): VRayImage
Parameters
x (integer)
y (integer)
width (integer)
height (integer)
Returns
VRayImage:
Example
var newImage = image.crop(10, 20, 30, 40);
newImage.save('crop.jpg', function(err) {});
▸ downscaleSync(width, height)

Creates a new V-Ray image which is a downscaled version of the current synchronously. The new image dimensions cannot be greater than the source image dimensions. This is a blocking call.

downscaleSync(width: integer, height: integer): VRayImage
Parameters
width (integer)
height (integer)
Returns
VRayImage: The new downscaled image.
Example
var newImage = image.downscaleSync(180, 180);
newImage.save('downscaled.jpg');
▸ fitInSync(width, height)

Either downscales or just clones the image to fit it into a rectangle with the given dimensions. This method preserves the image aspect ratio. This is a synchronous blocking call.

fitInSync(width: integer, height: integer): VRayImage
Parameters
width (integer)
height (integer)
Returns
VRayImage:
Example
var newImage = image.fitInSync(180, 180);
newImage.save('fit.jpg');
▸ cutInSync(width, height)

Either downscales or just clones the image in order for a rectangle to fit into the image. The new image is the part of the image that fits in the rectange. The other parts are cut. This method preserves the image aspect ratio. This is a synchronous blocking call.

cutInSync(width: integer, height: integer): VRayImage
Parameters
width (integer)
height (integer)
Returns
VRayImage:
Example
var newImage = image.cutInSync(180, 180);
newImage.save('cut.jpg', function(err) {});
▸ saveSync(fileName, [format], [quality], [preserveAlpha], [renderer])

Saves the V-Ray image to the specified file comressed in the specified format synchronously. This is a blocking call. Throws exception on failure.

saveSync(fileName: string, format: [string], quality: [integer], preserveAlpha: [boolean], renderer: [VRayRenderer])
Parameters
fileName (string) The name of the file.
format ([string]) Can be 'bmp', 'png' or 'jpg' ('jpeg'). Not required if the type can be determined from the filename extension.
quality ([integer] (default 0) ) The value of the parameter is an integer value between 0 and 100. Used for the jpeg format.
preserveAlpha ([boolean]) Used only for png and bmp formats.
renderer ([VRayRenderer]) If there are warnings and/or errors during the compression process, they will be emitted via dumpMessage event in the supplied renderer.
Example
image.saveSync('car.jpg');

BucketRegion

Represents a bucket region object. The (x, y) position represents the upper left coordinate of the bucket matrix.

BucketRegion
Properties
x (integer) : The top left X coordinate of the rendered bucket region.
y (integer) : The top left Y coordinate of the renderd bucket region.
width (integer) : The actual width of the rendered bucket region.
height (integer) : The actual height of the rendered bucket region.
host (string) : The name of the host that does the rendering for the bucket region.

VRayRenderer

Main class representing the renderer of V-Ray.

new VRayRenderer(rendererOptions: [JSON]): VRayRenderer
Parameters
rendererOptions ([JSON]) The options for the renderer represented as a JSON object.
Name Description
rendererOptions.imageWidth integer Sets the width of the rendered image in pixels.
rendererOptions.width integer Sets the width of the rendered image in pixels (the same as imageWidth).
rendererOptions.imageHeight integer Sets the height of the rendered image in pixels.
rendererOptions.height integer Sets the height of the rendered image in pixels (the same as imageHeight).
rendererOptions.pluginLibraryPath string Sets the current path to V-Ray plugins.
rendererOptions.gpuPluginPath string Sets the current path to GPU plugins.
rendererOptions.renderMode string Sets the current render mode.
The available values are: 
    <ul><li>'production' - <code>VRayRenderer</code>
    uses the Production engine instead of the RT one.</li>
    <li>'rtCpu' - <code>VRayRenderer</code> uses CPU for
    rendering.</li>
    <li>'rtGpuCuda' - <code>VRayRenderer</code>
    uses GPU for rendering with CUDA.</li>
        <li>'rtGpuOpenCl' - <code>VRayRenderer</code>
    uses GPU for rendering with OpenCL.</li></ul>
    <li>'productionCuda' - <code>VRayRenderer</code>
    uses the Production engine for rendering with CUDA.</li>
        <li>'productionOpenCl' - <code>VRayRenderer</code>
    uses the Production engine for rendering with OpenCL.</li></ul>
rendererOptions.rtSampleLevel integer Sets maximum paths per pixel when using the RT engine.
rendererOptions.rtNoiseThreshold float Sets the noise threshold for a frame when using the RT engine.
rendererOptions.rtTimeout long Sets a timeout (in mseconds) for a frame when using the RT engine.
rendererOptions.numThreads integer Sets the number of rendering threads.
rendererOptions.vfbDrawStyle integer Sets the V-Ray Frame Buffer draw style.
rendererOptions.enableFrameBuffer boolean Whether to enable/disable the VFB window creation.
rendererOptions.showFrameBuffer boolean Sets the frame buffer visibility.
rendererOptions.inProcess boolean Gets or sets whether the executing process participates in the rendering. The default value is true. If only V-Ray slaves are rendering (i.e. the rendering is out of process), then hosts for distributed rendering should be specified with the VRayRenderer.AddHosts(String) method before starting the rendering.
rendererOptions.keepRTRunning boolean Gets or sets whether the RT engine should not quit rendering if timeout or noise threshold are reached. Default is false which means quit.
rendererOptions.transferAssets boolean Gets or sets whether V-Ray should automatically transfer missing assets.
rendererOptions.useCachedAssets boolean Gets or sets whether V-Ray should try to use cached assets.
rendererOptions.bakeGamma boolean Gets or sets whether gamma is baked in VRayImages. Clear (default) to keep VRayImage data in linear space. Keep in mind that VRayImage methods will apply gamma correction if necessary when you want to get bmp, jpg, png, etc. Normally should not be set.
rendererOptions.noRenderLicensePreCheck boolean If set appsdk will not check for render license before rendering is started.
rendererOptions.noDR boolean Disables distributed rendering if set.
rendererOptions.useDefaultVfbTheme boolean Disable to inherit parent application GUI theme. Enabled by default.
rendererOptions.autoCommit boolean Sets the autoCommit flag indicating whether changes to the currently loaded render scene should be immediately committed or, alternatively, saved with an explicit call to the VRayRenderer commit method.
Properties
autoCommit (boolean)
imageReady (boolean) : Gets the status of the rendering process. True if the image has been rendered.
sequenceDone (boolean) : Gets the status of the animation rendering process. True if the animation sequence has finished.
Returns
VRayRenderer: V-Ray renderer
Example
var renderer = new vray.VRayRenderer();
Instance Members
▸ loadAsText(text)

Loads a scene text data which can be exported from 3Ds Max, Maya etc.

loadAsText(text: string)
Parameters
text (string)
▸ appendAsText(text)

Appends the scene text data to the currently loaded scene.

appendAsText(text: string)
Parameters
text (string) The text data of the scene.
▸ loadSync(fileName)

Loads a scene file (*.vrscene) which can be exported from 3Ds Max, Maya etc. This is a synchronous blocking call.

loadSync(fileName: string): (err | null)
Parameters
fileName (string) Relative or absolute name of the file with the V-Ray scene.
Returns
(err | null): Null or exception
Example
var success = renderer.loadSync('/scenes/car.vrscene', true);
▸ appendSync(filename)

Appends the scene file data to the currently loaded scene.

appendSync(filename: string)
Parameters
filename (string) The file of the V-Ray scene which will be appended.
Example
renderer.appendSync('/scenes/carAppend.vrscene');
▸ loadAsTextSync(text)

Loads a scene text data which can be exported from 3Ds Max, Maya etc. Synchronous blocking version. Throws an Error object on error.

loadAsTextSync(text: string)
Parameters
text (string)
▸ appendAsTextSync(text)

Appends the scene text data to the currently loaded scene. This is a synchronous blocking call.

appendAsTextSync(text: string)
Parameters
text (string) The text data of the scene.
▸ start([callback])

Starts the rendering process in a secondary thread. The call is not blocking.

start(callback: [function (error)])
Parameters
callback ([function (error)]) Optional callback to be called when the rendering has started
▸ stop([callback])

Stops the current rendering process.

stop(callback: [function (error)])
Parameters
callback ([function (error)]) Optional callback to be called when the rendering has stopped
Example
renderer.stop();
▸ startSync()

Starts the rendering process in a secondary thread. This is a synchronous blocking call.

startSync()
▸ renderSequence()

Starts the rendering of an animation sequence in a separate thread using the default animation sequence from the

renderSequence()
▸ continueSequence()

Starts the rendering of an animation sequence in a separate thread using the default animation sequence from the vrscene file

continueSequence()
▸ export(filePath, settings, callback)

Exports the currently loaded scene to the specified text file. The export serializes all plugins in text format. This is an asynchronous version.

export(filePath: string, settings: ExportSettings, callback: function (error))
Parameters
filePath (string) The path to the file where the scene will be exported. The file path must contain the name of the destination file. The export will not add a ".vrscene" extension to the file name if it is missing.
settings (ExportSettings) The settings for the export operation. The settings specify how and what type of scene elements are exported.
callback (function (error)) Callback to be called when the export finishes. Receives Error or null
▸ exportSync(filePath, settings)

Exports the currently loaded scene to the specified text file. The export serializes all plugins in text format. This is a synchronous blocking version.

exportSync(filePath: string, settings: ExportSettings): integer
Parameters
filePath (string) The path to the file where the scene will be exported. The file path must contain the name of the destination file. The export will not add a ".vrscene" extension to the file name if it is missing.
settings (ExportSettings) The settings for the export operation. The settings specify how and what type of scene elements are exported.
Returns
integer: errorCode
▸ addHostsSync(hosts)

Adds hosts to the renderer for distributed rendering. There is also an async version addHosts

addHostsSync(hosts: (string | Array<string>)): (err | null)
Parameters
hosts ((string | Array<string>)) A comma separated string and/or an array of strings or a combination of both representing the render host names, ip addresses or pairs ip:port.
Returns
(err | null): Null or exception - Usually you don't throw on this exception. It just tells you if there're errors connecting some hosts.
Example
var success = renderer.addHostsSync('10.0.0.32', '10.0.4.34:1234');
▸ removeHostsSync(hosts)

Removes hosts from the renderer for distributed rendering. This is a synchronous blocking call.

removeHostsSync(hosts: string): (err | null)
Parameters
hosts (string) A comma separated string and/or an array of strings or a combination of both representing the render host names, ip addresses or pairs ip:port.
Returns
(err | null): Null or exception - Usually you don't throw on this exception. It just tells you if there're errors removing some hosts.
Example
var success = renderer.removeHostsSync(["10.0.4.33", "10.0.4.34:1234"]);
▸ addHosts(hosts, callback)

Adds hosts to the renderer for distributed rendering.

addHosts(hosts: (string | Array<string>), callback: function (err))
Parameters
hosts ((string | Array<string>)) A comma separated string and/or an array of strings or a combination of both representing the render host names, ip addresses or pairs ip:port.
callback (function (err)) Called when all hosts have been resolved and connected (if possible).
Example
renderer.addHosts('10.0.0.32', '10.0.4.34:1234', function(err) {});
▸ removeHosts(hosts, callback)

Removes hosts from the renderer for distributed rendering.

removeHosts(hosts: string, callback: function (err))
Parameters
hosts (string) A comma separated string and/or an array of strings or a combination of both representing the render host names, ip addresses or pairs ip:port.
callback (function (err)) Called when all hosts have been resolved and removed (if possible).
Example
renderer.removeHosts(["10.0.4.33", "10.0.4.34:1234"], function(err) {});
▸ getAllHostsSync()

Gets an array of strings formatted as ip:port pairs for all active and inactive rendering hosts. This is a synchronous blocking call.

getAllHostsSync(): Array<string>
Returns
Array<string>:
Example
var hosts = renderer.getAllHostsSync();
▸ getActiveHostsSync()

Gets an array of strings formatted as ip:port pairs for all active rendering hosts. This is a synchronous blocking call.

getActiveHostsSync(): Array<string>
Returns
Array<string>:
Example
var activeHosts = renderer.getActiveHostsSync();
▸ getInactiveHostsSync()

Gets an array of strings formatted as ip:port pairs for all inactive rendering hosts. This is a synchronous blocking call.

getInactiveHostsSync(): Array<string>
Returns
Array<string>:
Example
var InactiveHosts = renderer.getInactiveHostsSync();
▸ getAllHosts(callback)

Gets an array of strings formatted as ip:port pairs for all active and inactive rendering hosts.

getAllHosts(callback: function (hosts))
Parameters
callback (function (hosts)) Called when the result is ready. The only argument of the callback is an array of strings containing the result.
Example
renderer.getAllHosts(function(hosts) {});
▸ getActiveHosts(callback)

Gets an array of strings formatted as ip:port pairs for all active rendering hosts.

getActiveHosts(callback: function (activeHosts))
Parameters
callback (function (activeHosts)) Called when the result is ready. The only argument of the callback is an array of strings containing the result.
Example
renderer.getActiveHosts(function(activeHosts) {});
▸ getInactiveHosts(callback)

Gets an array of strings formatted as ip:port pairs for all inactive rendering hosts.

getInactiveHosts(callback: function (inactiveHosts)): Array<string>
Parameters
callback (function (inactiveHosts)) Called when the result is ready. The only argument of the callback is an array of strings containing the result.
Returns
Array<string>:
Example
renderer.getInactiveHosts(function(InactiveHosts) {});
▸ bucketRenderNearest(x, y)

In Production mode the method provides the coordinates for a nearby bucket to be rendered. If the selected bucket has already been rendered, a closest bucket will be picked with a minimum distance to the specified coordinates. The coordinates must be within the dimensions of the currently rendered image, otherwise the method has no effect. The method has also no effect in RT modes.

bucketRenderNearest(x: number, y: number)
Parameters
x (number) The x coordinate for a nearby bucket. Must be between 0 and ImageWidth inclusive.
y (number) The y coordinate for a nearby bucket. Must be between 0 and ImageHeight inclusive.
▸ waitForImageReady([timeout], callback)

Waits for the rendering to finish. If timeout is specified, waits no more than the timeout. After this the callback function is called. The parameters can be in any order.

waitForImageReady(timeout: [integer], callback: function (err))
Parameters
timeout ([integer]) Timeout value in milliseconds.
callback (function (err))
Example
renderer.waitForImageReady(10000, function() {
renderer.close();
});
▸ waitForSequenceDone(timeout, callback)

Waits for rendering of an animation sequence to finish. This is a non-blocking call.

waitForSequenceDone(timeout: integer, callback: function (boolean))
Parameters
timeout (integer) The timeout in milliseconds after which the waiting terminates if the sequenced is not finished in the meantime.
callback (function (boolean)) Callback called with True if the sequence has been finished, False if timeout or error occurred.
▸ commit()

Commits any changes that had been previously introduced but not committed.

commit(): boolean
Returns
boolean: True if OK, false otherwise.
Example
var success = renderer.commit();
▸ setRTImageUpdateDifference(difference)

Sets the maximum difference threshold between 2 intermediate images returned by VRay RT during rendering to be used as a criterion when to send the current image in the callback event.

setRTImageUpdateDifference(difference: float): float
Parameters
difference (float) The new value
Returns
float: The old value.
▸ setRTImageUpdateTimeout(timeout)

Sets the maximum timeout interval (in milliseconds) during VRay RT rendering to send the current image in the callback even if the difference criteria is not met.

setRTImageUpdateTimeout(timeout: integer): integer
Parameters
timeout (integer) Timeout value in milliseconds.
Returns
integer: The old value in milliseconds.
▸ clearAllPropertyValuesUpToTime(time)

Related to animations - clears the values of all properties up to the given time.

clearAllPropertyValuesUpToTime(time: number)
Parameters
time (number)
▸ getImage()

Gets the current image from renderer.

getImage(): VRrayImage
Returns
VRrayImage: Returns a VRay image or null if the image has been rendered.
Example
var image = renderer.getImage();
image.save('car.jpg', function(err) {});
▸ getBoundingBox()

Returns the whole scene bounding box excluding infinite primitives.

getBoundingBox()
▸ getRTStatistics()

Returns RT renderer statistics: 'paths per second', 'elapsed ticks' and 'sample level'.

getRTStatistics(): RTStatistics
Returns
RTStatistics: RTStatistics on success or undefined on failure.
▸ pause()

Pauses RT rendering process.

pause()
▸ resume()

Resumes RT rendering process.

resume()
▸ saveImage(fileName, [flags], [callback])

Saves the current image from renderer to file. This allows you to save as some formats (TIFF) not supported by the VRayImage class. This is an asynchronous version.

saveImage(fileName: string, flags: [SaveImageFlags], callback: [function (err)])
Parameters
fileName (string)
flags ([SaveImageFlags])
callback ([function (err)])
▸ saveImageSync(fileName, [flags])

Saves the current image from renderer to file. This allows you to save as some formats (TIFF) not supported by the VRayImage class. This is an asynchronous version.

saveImageSync(fileName: string, flags: [SaveImageFlags]): number
Parameters
fileName (string)
flags ([SaveImageFlags])
Returns
number: errorCode
▸ getComputeDevicesCUDA()

Returns a list of all devices available for use by the CUDA engine.

getComputeDevicesCUDA(): Array<ComputeDeviceInfo>
Returns
Array<ComputeDeviceInfo>: Empty list on failure.
▸ getComputeDevicesOpenCL()

Returns a list of all devices available for use by the OpenCL engine.

getComputeDevicesOpenCL(): Array<ComputeDeviceInfo>
Returns
Array<ComputeDeviceInfo>: Empty list on failure.
▸ setComputeDevicesCUDA(deviceIds)

Set which devices to use for rendering with the CUDA engine.

setComputeDevicesCUDA(deviceIds: Array<integer>): any
Parameters
deviceIds (Array<integer>) The indices of the devices to use as returned by GetComputeDevicesCUDA
Returns
any: False if an error occured.
▸ setComputeDevicesOpenCL(deviceIds)

Set which devices to use for rendering with the OpenCL engine.

setComputeDevicesOpenCL(deviceIds: Array<integer>): any
Parameters
deviceIds (Array<integer>) The indices of the devices to use as returned by GetComputeDevicesOpenCL
Returns
any: False if an error occured.
▸ denoiseNow()

Explicitly starts the denoiser. Requires a RenderChannelDenoiser instance in the scene. This can be run while rendering is ongoing or when it's paused or after it is stopped. Denoising parameters are taken from the RenderChannelDenoiser plugin. The denoising is run asynchronously, so this function will return as soon as the thread is started. When denoising is done the postEffectsUpdated callback will be called.

denoiseNow(): any
Returns
any: true if the denoising thread is started successfully and false if there is a problem with the parameters or renderer state
▸ close([callback])

Closes the VRayRenderer in V-Ray which stops the rendering process and releases all resources associated with it. Once closed, a VRayRenderer instance cannot be used anymore. If the optional callback is not provided, this function is synchronous and may have a significant performance impact.

close(callback: [function ()])
Parameters
callback ([function ()]) Optional callback to be called when the renderer has been closed
Example
renderer.close(function() { console.log('Renderer has been closed'); });
▸ reset([rendererOptions])

Clears all plugins from the renderer. Using this method you can reuse a renderer instance. Accepts an optional RendererOptions object, the same as the VRayRenderer constructor.

reset(rendererOptions: [JSON]): boolean
Parameters
rendererOptions ([JSON]) The options for the renderer represented as a JSON object.
Returns
boolean: Success or failure
▸ setImprovedDefaults()

Initializes some settings plugins to recommended values. Call on an empty scene before your own changes. This should be done before applying your own settings and before starting a render. The values are better than the defaults. The defaults remain as they are for compatibility reasons. To see what got changed, export the scene after that to a file and inspect it.

setImprovedDefaults(): boolean
Returns
boolean: True on success
▸ load(fileName, callback)

Loads a scene file (*.vrscene) which can be exported from 3Ds Max, Maya etc.

load(fileName: string, callback: function (err))
Parameters
fileName (string) Relative or absolute name of the file with the V-Ray scene.
callback (function (err)) Called when the scene is loaded. The second and third parameters can be in any order.
Example
renderer.load('/scenes/car.vrscene', function(err) {
if (err) throw err;
renderer.start();
});
▸ append(filename, callback)

Appends the scene file data to the currently loaded scene.

append(filename: string, callback: function (err))
Parameters
filename (string) The file of the V-Ray scene which will be appended.
callback (function (err)) Called after the data has been appended.
Example
renderer.append('/scenes/carAppend.vrscene', function(err) {});

VRayRenderer#bucketFailed

Called when a bucket has failed rendering.

VRayRenderer#bucketFailed
Parameters
callback (function (region)) Called when the event occurs. The callback function has one argument - a BucketRegion instance.
Example
renderer.on('bucketFailed', function(region) {
console.log('New bucket has failed rendering.');
});

Serializes the whole scene (plugins with their property values) contained in the renderer into a single memory stream no matter if they originate from a loaded or appended vrscene file or are created by code. The whole stream will be always transferred when DR hosts are connected. No DR hosts should have been connected before serialization. (Currently only one type of serialization is supported but other types may be added in the future.) This method is here mainly for debug purposes but it can be helpful in some other cases as well. Do not use it unless you know exactly what you're doing.

VRayRenderer#bucketReady

Called when a bucket has been rendered.

VRayRenderer#bucketReady
Parameters
callback (function (bucket)) The only argument of the callback function is a BucketImage instance.
Example
renderer.on('bucketReady', function(bucket) {
console.log('Bucket is ready.');
});

VRayRenderer#dumpMessage

Called when a new message from V-Ray is received. There are three types of messages - info, warning and error messages.

VRayRenderer#dumpMessage
Parameters
callback (function (str, level)) The callback function has two arguments - the first one is String - the message text and the second is an integer - the message level that distinguishes the different message types.
Example
renderer.on('dumpMessage', function(message, level) {
console.log(message);
});

VRayRenderer#progress

Called when item of the rendering process is ready.

VRayRenderer#progress
Parameters
callback (function (message, progress, total)) The callback function has three arguments - the first one is String - the progress message text; the second and third are integers - the number of processed items and the total number of items
Example
renderer.on('progress', function(msg, progress, total) {
console.log("Progress:", msg, (100*progress/total).toFixed(2) + '%');
});

VRayRenderer#start

Called when the rendering process actually started.

VRayRenderer#start
Parameters
callback (function ()) Called when the event occurs.
Example
renderer.on('start', function() {
	console.log('Rendering started.');
});

VRayRenderer#imageReady

Called when the rendering process has finished and the final image is ready. The image can be obtained by VRayRenderer.getImage in the callback.

VRayRenderer#imageReady
Parameters
callback (function ())
Example
renderer.on('imageReady', function() {
console.log('Image is ready.');
var img = renderer.getImage();
});

VRayRenderer#rtImageUpdated

Called when a new frame, rendered by the RT engine, has been received. Used also in progressive production and in some pre-passes in bucket production.

VRayRenderer#rtImageUpdated
Parameters
callback (function (image)) The only argument of the callback is a VRayImage instance that contains the current frame.
Example
renderer.on('rtImageUpdated', function() {
console.log('Image updated.');
});

vray

The main vray module

vray
Static Members
▸ createVRayRenderer([rendererOptions], [callback])

Creates a VRayRenderer asynchronously

createVRayRenderer(rendererOptions: [RendererOptions], callback: [function (err, renderer)])
Parameters
rendererOptions ([RendererOptions]) The options for the renderer represented as a JSON object.
callback ([function (err, renderer)]) Callback to be called with the renderer created
▸ createVRayServer([serverOptions], [callback])

Creates a VRayServer asynchronously

createVRayServer(serverOptions: [ServerOptions], callback: [function (err, server)])
Parameters
serverOptions ([ServerOptions]) The options for the server represented as a JSON object.
callback ([function (err, server)]) Callback to be called with the server created
▸ setLicenseServers()

Sets the license server config

setLicenseServers(): number
Returns
number: 0 on success or error code otherwise

VRayRenderer#bucketInit

Called when a new bucket is issued for rendering by V-Ray.

VRayRenderer#bucketInit
Parameters
callback (function (region)) Called when the event occurs. The callback function has one argument - a BucketRegion instance.
Example
renderer.on('bucketInit', function(region) {
console.log('New bucket being rendered.');
});

VRayServer#connect

Called when a renderer attaches to the port of the server. The callback receives a string "host" parameter.

VRayServer#connect
Parameters
callback (function (host))
Example
server.on('connect', function(host) {
console.log('V-Ray server connected');
});

VRayServer

Creates a V-Ray server instance.

new VRayServer(serverOptions: [JSON]): VRayServer
Parameters
serverOptions ([JSON])
Name Description
serverOptions.portNumber [integer] (default 0) The port number of the render host.
serverOptions.numThreads [integer] (default 0) The number of running rendering threads.
serverOptions.pluginLibraryPath [string] Additional paths to folders containing V-Ray plugins.
serverOptions.remoteScenePath [string] The folder in which the received vrscene-file will be written, default is the temp folder.
serverOptions.gpuPluginPath [string] Folder to look for rt_cuda and rt_opencl.
serverOptions.noRenderLicensePreCheck [boolean] Do not check if render node license is available when creating the server (it�s always checked when rendering is started), default: false.
serverOptions.changeCurrentDirectory [boolean] Change the current folder to remoteScenePath, default: false.
serverOptions.keepSceneInMemory [boolean] Do not write a temporary vrscene-file, keep the scene data in memory only, default: false.
serverOptions.overwriteLocalCacheSettings [boolean] True to override any local cache settings on the render servers with the value from the client machine. Default: false.
serverOptions.cachedAssetsLimitType [integer] 0 for no limiting; 1 for time limiting; 2 for space limiting. See cachedAssetsLimitValue. Default: 0.
serverOptions.cachedAssetsLimitValue [float] Value for the cache limit (hours or GB). Default: 0.0.
Returns
VRayServer:
Example
var server = vray.VRayServer({portNumber: 8888});
Instance Members
▸ close()

Closes the server.

close()
Example
server.close();
▸ start()

Runs the server in a separate thread.

start()
Example
server.start();
▸ stop()

Stops the server

stop()
Example
server.stop();

VRayServer#disconnect

Called when a renderer detaches from the port of the server.

VRayServer#disconnect
Parameters
callback (function ())
Example
server.on('disconnect', function() {
console.log('V-Ray server disconnected.);
});

VRayServer#dumpMessage

Called when a new message from V-Ray server is received. The three types of messages are info, warning and error.

VRayServer#dumpMessage
Parameters
callback (function (str, level)) The callback function has two argiments - the first is a String - the message text, and the second is an integer - the message level, which distinguishes the different message types.
Example
server.on('dumpMessage', function(message, level) {
console.log(message);
});
